member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType
member.summary: Defines the interpreting type (CTable, NTable or Other) of customer information for AustralianPost BarCode.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.CTable
member.summary: Use CTable to interpret the customer information. Allows A..Z, a..z, 1..9, space and # sing.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.NTable
member.summary: Use NTable to interpret the customer information. Allows digits.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.CustomerInformationInterpretingType.Other
member.summary: Do not interpret the customer information. Allows 0, 1, 2 or 3 symbol only.

BarcodeGenerator for backend barcode images generation.
supported symbologies: 1D: Codabar, Code11, Code128, Code39Standard, Code39Extended Code93Standard, Code93Extended, EAN13, EAN8, Interleaved2of5, MSI, Standard2of5, UPCA, UPCE, ISBN, GS1Code128, Postnet, Planet EAN14, SCC14, SSCC18, ITF14, SingaporePost ... 2D: Aztec, DataMatrix, PDf417, QR code ...

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.AutoSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies the different types of automatic sizing modes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.AutoSizeMode.None
member.summary: Automatic resizing is disabled.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.AutoSizeMode.Nearest
member.summary: Resizes barcode to nearest lowest possible size specified by BarCodeWidth and BarCodeHeight properties. Preserves default aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.AutoSizeMode.Interpolation
member.summary: Resizes barcode to specified size. Size can be specified by BarCodeWidth and BarCodeHeight properties. Generated barcode may be invalid (not readable) after scaling.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters
member.summary: Barcode generation parameters.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.XDimension
member.summary: x-dimension is the smallest width of the unit of BarCode bars or spaces. Increase this will increase the whole barcode image width. Ignored if property is set to AutoSizeMode.Nearest or AutoSizeMode.Interpolation.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.BarHeight
member.summary: Height of 1D barcodes' bars in value. Ignored if property is set to AutoSizeMode.Nearest or AutoSizeMode.Interpolation.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.AutoSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies the different types of automatic sizing modes. Default value: AutoSizeMode.None.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.BarCodeHeight
member.summary: BarCode image height when property is set to AutoSizeMode.Nearest or AutoSizeMode.Interpolation.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.BarCodeWidth
member.summary: BarCode image width when property is set to AutoSizeMode.Nearest or AutoSizeMode.Interpolation.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.ForeColor
member.summary: Bars color. Default value: Color.Black.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.Padding
member.summary: Barcode paddings. Default value: 5pt 5pt 5pt 5pt.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.ChecksumAlwaysShow
member.summary: Always display checksum digit in the human readable text for Code128 and GS1Code128 barcodes.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbology which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN, Codabar
Checksum always used: Rest symbology

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. Used for Pdf417, DataMatrix, Code128 only If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters. Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters. For example, \013 and \\CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: Only for 1D barcodes. If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Otherwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbology if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbology if codetext is incorrect.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.BarcodeParameters.WideNarrowRatio
member.summary: Wide bars to Narrow bars ratio. Default value: 3, that is, wide bars are 3 times as wide as narrow bars. Used for ITF, PZN, PharmaCode, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, IATA2of5, VIN, DeutschePost, OPC, Code32, DataLogic2of5, PatchCode, Code39Extended, Code39Standard

exception.p: The WideNarrowRatio parameter value is less than or equal to 0.

member.summary: The Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes recognition.

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Default
member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be validated.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.On
member.summary: Always validate checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Off
member.summary: Do not validate checksum.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint
member.summary: Manual hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.None
member.summary: There are no heavy recognition algorithms. The fastest recognition algorithms are used there, however if image is noisy recognition will fail. Used by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.InvertImage
member.summary: Use when image is white on black background. Typically BarCode images are black on white background.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.IncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Addition algorithms are included to recognize incorrectly generated or damaged barcodes (skipped bars, stop symbol, etc). May return deniable recognition.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.ComplexBackground
member.summary: Analyzes barcode background. Useful with complex or colored backgrounds.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.MedianSmoothing
member.summary: MedianSmoothing. Works with BarcodeReader's MedianSmoothingWindowSize property. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRestoration
member.summary: Starts recognition using only the restoration algorithms from MaxQuality mode.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.UseRegular
member.summary: Starts recognition using algorithms from MaxPerfomance mode. Useful to combine with other hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SpecialFormOfCells
member.summary: Starts recognition barcodes with the special form of cells. Example: dot peen Datamatrix. The MaxQuality mode includes this flag by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.SkipRotatedBarcodes
member.summary: Switches off algorithms of rotating and so increases the recognition speed. It works only for Datamatrix and linear barcodes.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Recognition modes. Note: only one recognition mode can be selected.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxPerformance
member.summary: Finds all the possible good and average quality barcodes. Uses only the fastest algorithms. Enabled by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxQuality
member.summary: Finds all the possible barcodes with good or bad quality. Doesn't return potential barcodes. Uses different fast and slow algorithms.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxBarCodes
member.summary: Extends MaxQuality. Finds even potential barcodes. Uses extra algorithms which may recognize incorrect barcodes, barcodes on complex background, noisy or damaged barcodes and etc. You may observe extra spurious barcodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.ManualHints
member.summary: User configures hints optionally. Allows you to adjust the balance between speed and quality manually.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.MultyDecodeType
member.summary: Composite decode type.
member.example:
This sample shows how to create compound MultyDecode types that combine SingleDecodeType and MultiDecode types.
[C#] MultyDecodeType types1 = new MultyDecodeType(DecodeType.QR, DecodeType.DataMatrix); MultyDecodeType types2 = new MultyDecodeType(types1, DecodeType.Code128, DecodeType.Code39Standard); [VB.NET] Dim multyType1 As MultyDecodeType multyType1 = New MultyDecodeType(DecodeType.QR, DecodeType.DataMatrix) Dim multyType2 As MultyDecodeType multyType2 = New MultyDecodeType(multyType1, DecodeType.Code128, DecodeType.Code39Standard)

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings
P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.HighPerformance
member.value: HighPerformance recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.NormalQuality
member.value: NormalQuality recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.HighQuality
member.value: HighQuality recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.MaxBarCodes
member.value: MaxBarCodes recognition quality preset.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowInvertImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize inverse color image as additional scan. Mode can be used when barcode is white on black background.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize inverse color image.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowIncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize barcodes which has incorrect checksumm or incorrect values. Mode can be used to recognize damaged barcodes with incorrect text.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize incorrect barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowComplexBackground
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize color barcodes on color background as additional scan. Extremely slow mode.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize color barcodes on color background.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowMedianSmoothing
member.summary: Allows engine to enable median smoothing as additional scan. Mode helps to recognize noised barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine to enable median smoothing.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.MedianSmoothingWindowSize
member.summary: Window size for median smoothing. Typical values are 3 or 4. Default value is 3. AllowMedianSmoothing must be set.
member.value: Window size for median smoothing.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowRegularImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize regular image without any restorations as main scan. Mode to recognize image as is.
member.value: Allows to recognize regular image without any restorations.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDecreasedImage
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize decreased image as additional scan. Size for decreasing is selected by internal engine algorithms. Mode helps to recognize barcodes which are noised and blurred but captured with high resolution.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize decreased image

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowWhiteSpotsRemoving
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize image without small white spots as additional scan. Mode helps to recognize noised image as well as median smoothing filtering.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize image without small white spots.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowOneDAdditionalScan
member.summary: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to recognize regular image with different params as additional scan. Mode helps to recongize low height 1D barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to run additional scan.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowOneDFastBarcodesDetector
member.summary: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to quickly recognize high quality barcodes which fill almost whole image. Mode helps to quickly recognize generated barcodes from Internet.
member.value: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to quickly recognize high quality barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowMicroWhiteSpotsRemoving
member.summary: Allows engine for Postal barcodes to recognize slightly noised images. Mode helps to recognize sligtly damaged Postal barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for Postal barcodes to recognize slightly noised images.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowSaltAndPaperFiltering
member.summary: Allows engine to recognize barcodes with salt and paper noise type. Mode can remove small noise with white and black dots.
member.value: Allows engine to recognize barcodes with salt and paper noise type.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDetectScanGap
member.summary: Allows engine to use gap between scans to increase recognition speed. Mode can make recognition problems with low height barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine to use gap between scans to increase recognition speed.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowDatamatrixIndustrialBarcodes
member.summary: Allows engine for Datamatrix to recognize dashed industrial Datamatrix barcodes. Slow mode which helps only for dashed barcodes which consist from spots.
member.value: Allows engine for Datamatrix to recognize dashed industrial barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowQRMicroQrRestoration
member.summary: Allows engine for QR/MicroQR to recognize damaged MicroQR barcodes.
member.value: Allows engine for QR/MicroQR to recognize damaged MicroQR barcodes.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeRecognition.QualitySettings.AllowOneDWipedBarsRestoration
member.summary: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to recognize barcodes with single wiped/glued bars in pattern.
member.value: Allows engine for 1D barcodes to recognize barcodes with single wiped/glued bars in pattern.

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.summary: Always use checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.EnableChecksum.No
member.summary: Do not use checksum.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.Generation.EncodeTypes.UpcaGs1DatabarCoupon
member.summary: Specifies that the data should be encoded with UPC coupon with GS1 DataBar addition barcode specification. An example of the input string: BarCodeBuilder.Codetext = "514141100906(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000", where UPCA part is "514141100906", Databar part is "(8110)106141416543213500110000310123196000". To change the caption, use barCodeBuilder.CaptionAbove.Text = "company prefix + offer code";

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.MarginsF
member.summary: Specifies the margins of a barcode image.

remarks.p: This class is used to manipulate margins in barcode image.
Note : The actual amount of the margins are determined by the specified mesure unit of the barcode image.
Left, Right, Top, and Bottom are properties that define the margins.
Equals determines if another object is equal to a MarginsF object.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode
member.summary: Encoding mode for QR barcodes. It is recommended to Use Auto with CodeTextEncoding = Encoding.UTF8 for Latin symbols or digits and Utf8BOM for Unicode symbols.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Auto
member.summary: Encode codetext as is non-Unicode charset. If there is any Unicode character, the codetext will be encoded with value which is set in CodeTextEncoding.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Bytes
member.summary: Encode codetext as plain bytes. If it detects any Unicode character, the character will be encoded as two bytes, lower byte first.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Utf8BOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.Utf16BEBOM
member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character. It can be problems with some barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.ECIEncoding
member.summary: Encode codetext with value set in the ECIEncoding property. It can be problems with some old (pre 2006) barcode scanners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.ExtendedCodetext

summary.para: Extended Channel mode which supports FNC1 first position, FNC1 second position and multi ECI modes.
It is better to use QrExtCodetextBuilder for extended codetext generation.
Use Display2DText property to set visible text to removing managing characters.
Encoding Principles:
All symbols "\" must be doubled "\\" in the codetext.
FNC1 in first position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1>"
FNC1 in second position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1(value)>". The value must be single symbols (a-z, A-Z) or digits from 0 to 99.
Group Separator for FNC1 modes is set as 0x1D character '\\u001D'
If you need to insert "<FNC1>" string into barcode write it as "<\FNC1>"
ECI identifiers are set as single slash and six digits identifier "\000026" - UTF8 ECI identifier
TO disable current ECI mode and convert to default JIS8 mode zero mode ECI indetifier is set. "\000000"
All unicode characters after ECI identifier are automatically encoded into correct character codeset.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType
member.summary: QR / MicroQR selector mode. Select ForceQR for standard QR symbols, Auto for MicroQR. ForceMicroQR is used for strongly MicroQR symbol generation if it is possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType.Auto
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from MicroQR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType.ForceQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from QR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType.ForceMicroQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from from MicroQR V1 to V4. If data cannot be encoded into MicroQR, exception is thrown.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.QRErrorLevel

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QRErrorLevel.LevelL

member.summary: Allows recovery of 15% of the code text

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QRErrorLevel.LevelQ
member.summary: Allows recovery of 25% of the code text

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QRErrorLevel.LevelH
member.summary: Allows recovery of 30% of the code text

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.
